Articles.Content:
Those trees look pretty darn good. Are the Munar and... Minmian? terrain scatters going to be improved soon? A-la bigger more diverse boulders to give a more realistic feel? Oh and is there any plans in the works to implement dust as we eva?

On a positive note I was incredible suprised to see how many celestial objects were planned to be added this update, Ifigured it would be a one at a time thing but nope, were getting what 4 planets and 6 moons I think? Gonna be a major game changer for KSP.

And one more question, and the most important at that; Will we be receviing any type of a "rover assemby building"? As in a building using smaller parts to build rovers for packing in cargo modules on rockets?

Off-topic: I seem to be unable to change certain settings on my profile, could a mod help me out? It says I don't have permission. I'm trying to put this: http://www.panoramas.dk/moon/apollo-11-the-first-man-on-moon.html

into a sig or on my profile.

Edited September 6, 2012 by DimethylMercury
message for mods

Those trees look pretty darn good. Are the Munar and... Minmian? terrain scatters going to be improved soon? A-la bigger more diverse boulders to give a more realistic feel? Oh and is there any plans in the works to implement dust as we eva?

On a positive note I was incredible suprised to see how many celestial objects were planned to be added this update, Ifigured it would be a one at a time thing but nope, were getting what 4 planets and 6 moons I think? Gonna be a major game changer for KSP.

And one more question, and the most important at that; Will we be receviing any type of a "rover assemby building"? As in a building using smaller parts to build rovers for packing in cargo modules on rockets?

Off-topic: I seem to be unable to change certain settings on my profile, could a mod help me out? It says I don't have permission. I'm trying to put this: http://www.panoramas.dk/moon/apollo-11-the-first-man-on-moon.html

into a sig or on my profile.

Maybe as a secret feature in this update, but probably not, though it would probably be about the same difficulty to implement as EVA's. Would be pretty cool though. Especially if you could add features like seats to your rover so it can be either robotic or Kerbal piloted.

On-topic: Will Duna or any of the other planets have any huge mountains? Like Olympus Mons on Mars. It would be pretty cool to land on and have an awesome perspective from, or to establish a small outpost at the base.
I can't find the patcher in my KSP folder neither in the archive I've downloaded from KSP store. What's up with that?
Wow nice trees Nova! They look pretty realistic and still kerbal stylish (cartonish, how would you name it?).

No more Nintendo64 trees! Looks nice.

I hope the good old palm trees make a comeback someday, for some reason I miss those leafy place holders.
Newer trees look good, still seem out of proportion though, they seem way too big compared to a rocket (unless trees just grow giant on Kerbal)

Wow this topic grows fast!

I love these small updates, thanks Nova.

[ATTACH=CONFIG]32586[/ATTACH]

Especially this one, it looks fantastic!

It must be really cool to create all these body's isn't it?

That colour looks different from what I remember seeing, is it becase it's on the night side or as tHe colour been changed? And that moon looks freaking awesome by the way nova! I might be a bit after everybody else with developing interplanetary rockets and stuff, but I'll get there eventually,I'll probably use parachutes.

Edited September 6, 2012 by Polar Bear

What's in your eyes mate? On the Night Side Shadows, sure.

Nice trees Nova and good Picture from Duna(?)

I want it NOW!

Wow great tress, they relay look amazing.. but whats the poly count on them..300-600??

- More importantly how much will they affect framerates?
I think between 35 and 75 would be a good guess for the poly count on the trees. Double that for a tri count.
ahhhhhh there are so many new things to look at in this update, that orange sky for duna looks AWESOME!

That colour looks different from what I remember seeing, is it becase it's on the night side or as tHe colour been changed?

Its the Twilight Zone ... ! Gotta say that moon looks a bit banged up.

I'm getting psyched for the mini-SRB's, actually. They can be especially helpful for staging, such as moving radial drop tanks away from your spacecraft. And also, in emergencies, instead of simply having the pod detached from plane and open parachutes, it can rocket away form the out of control plane.

and.... oh yea, missiles.

That colour looks different from what I remember seeing, is it becase it's on the night side or as tHe colour been changed?

I don't know if the colors have changed, but it is indeed growing late in that picture; Just look at the shadows and how tall they are

Little thing I added to 0.17, new tree meshes - the old placeholders were WAY overdue for a replacement!

Why are they so big?
Clearly, they are the great tree-homes of ancient Kerbalkind.

Why are they so big?

How big ARE trees supposed to be you derp? TREE SIZE!
they are like 15-20 metres tall if you take the diameter of the small tank (1m) and use it as a ruler about the same as trees should be
maybe trees on kerbin are just alot bigger then trees on earth
maybe the kerbals are just small and 1m at kerbin is smaller than our meter is.

maybe trees on kerbin are just alot bigger then trees on earth

Yep. I tried them smaller but it just didn't feel right. I think it also helps to communicate that kerbals and their machines are quite small.

Dead Hall (the guy who did Dayz) just tweeted he plays KSP.

https://twitter.com/rocket2guns

Thought that was pretty nice shout out by a fan.

Dead Hall (the guy who did Dayz) just tweeted he plays KSP.

https://twitter.com/rocket2guns

Thought that was pretty nice shout out by a fan.

Loving the relevance to 0.17

On-topic: Will any of the planets have "amplified" terrain, as in the features dwarf your space craft. There's a valley on the moon that makes your space craft feel incredibly small. It would be cool if there were some really interesting terrain features on planets such as Duna or Eve.
I'd love to see the equivalent of Valles Marineris on Duna. It would be even more spectacular since we can now see the terrain's imperfections and form from orbit.
